page.title: 01North of Inverkeithing
page.content:
Fife is a very fertile region, and the area south of Dunfermline and north of the Forth eastuary provides rich arable land, facing south on gently sloping hills, which is perfect for crops such as{wheat},{barley}and{oil {seed rape}. Not surprisingly, from the north of Inverkeithing the area is almost entirely composed of farmland.
{Fordell}and the parish of{Dalgety} provide a rich history, mainly of mining (Fife is on a rich coal seam), traces of which can still be seen today.
Now, Fordell is the{Scottish Scouts {Headquarters,}with an international campsite.
